CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 24, 1954, pg. 11, reads: "Alpha Picnic - As usual the Alpha picnic attracted a large crowd of fun-lovers who responded to the clever invitations sent out by the members of the fraternity, by taking them up on their invite to spend a day with Robin Hood in Sherwood's Forest...Typical of the many tables filled with guests was the one pictured in center photo. Marie Hamilton is pictured with her back to the camera we she chats with and unidentified guest, as Oscar Harris looks on.  Others in the group are Marjorie Harris, Deanne Curtis Wesley, her mother, Gladys Curtis, and Sidney Taylor Brown... - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two men, possibly including Oscar Harris wearing striped shirt, and five women, including Marie Hamilton facing away, Marjorie Harris in center, Deanne Curtis Wesley, Gladys Curtis, and Sidney Taylor, gathered around picnic table with food covered with cloths, for Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity picnic, North Park
